name: Avoid using late binding
description:
Avoid using late binding.

Late binding is done when a call to CreateObject is done AND that the variables are of type Object/Variant.
Whenever  a variable is typed during the definition (dim var as MyObject) it becomes early binding.
output: This report lists all uses of late binding
rationale:
Even if late binding offer advantages (like being version independent), it suffers from several disadvantages compared to early binding. 
With early binding:
- Code is much faster
- Compiler can detect error at compilation time rather than execution time
- Intellisense is available
remediationSample:
dim xl  as Excel.Application
Set xl = CreateObject("Excel.Application")
sample:
dim xl  as object
Set xl = CreateObject("Excel.Application")
